t: Proverbs 2
The Pursuit of Wisdom Brings Security
My*pn son, if you will receive my words And*ln treasure my commandments within you,
Make*ln your ear attentive to wisdom, Incline*ln your heart to understanding;
For*ln if you cry for discernment, Lift*ln your voice for understanding;
If*ln you seek her as silver And*ln search for her as for hidden treasures;
Then*ln you will discern the fear of the Lord*s And*ln discover the knowledge of God.
For*ln the Lord*s gives wisdom; From*ln His mouth come*i knowledge and understanding.
He*ln stores up sound wisdom for the upright; He*iln is*i a shield to those who walk in integrity,
Guarding*ln the paths of justice, And*ln He preserves the way of His godly ones.
Then*ln you will discern righteousness and justice And*ln equity and*i every good course.
For*ln wisdom will enter your heart And*ln knowledge will be pleasant to your soul;
Discretion*ln will guard you, Understanding*ln will watch over you,
To*ln deliver you from the way of evil, From*ln the man who speaks perverse things;
From*ln those who leave the paths of uprightness To*ln walk in the ways of darkness;
Who*ln delight in doing evil And*ln rejoice in the perversity of evil;
Whose*ln paths are crooked, And*ln who are devious in their ways;
To*ln deliver you from the strange woman, From*ln the adulteress who flatters with her words;
That*ln leaves the companion of her youth And*ln forgets the covenant of her God;
For*ln her house sinks down to death And*ln her tracks lead*i to the dead;
None*ln who go to her return again, Nor*ln do they reach the paths of life.
So*ln you will walk in the way of good men And*ln keep to the paths of the righteous.
For*ln the upright will live in the land And*ln the blameless will remain in it;
But*ln the wicked will be cut off from the land And*ln the treacherous will be uprooted from it.
